reviews.review: Good sequel but dragged on a little. Kids enjoyed it!
Lots of laughs and few sad moments but great sequel.
it was ok, and had its moments. The songs were oddly generic. And, they went the route of retconning things from the first movie that left me thinking why these things weren't brought up then.
Liked Olaf, the clothes, the story about parents. Disliked the songs.  Not as good as first one

Frozen 2 had a good story but unfortunately the songs weren't up to par.  None of them were particularly memorable.  Worse than the songs, however, was how they were generally performed, rather like a stage show.  The characters posed and performed as if to an audience rather than trying to express their feelings as in pretty much any other musical.  This, while different, was distracting and someone should've caught it before putting the film out.  The ending resulted in a situation that I don't feel that the sisters would've settled for, but was ultimately satisfying.
I liked the story and my daughter enjoyed the movie so much.  Very entertaining.
Fantastic sequel and the sounds were great!

In most respects, Frozen II is even better than its overexposed predecessor with a more engaging, darker and more complex plot, gorgeous visuals that surpass those of the first film, great voice acting and enjoyable songs that totally won't get more airplay in the future. Though, if you ask me, although Disney REALLY wants "Into the Unknown" to be the next "Let it Go", that honour goes to a different song. It helps that this song has more elaborate animation compared to the one that's gunning for a "Best Original Song" Oscar. While the new characters could've used some additional development and it can feel a bit underwhelming that the movie, while still more complex than the first film, isn't a big action-packed epic like you might expect from the trailers, I did enjoy Frozen II for the most part and prefer it over the first film. Just be cautious with your expectations because you're either on board with the storytelling decisions of this movie or you're not and I didn't find anything narratively flawed compared to the last non-Pixar CGI Disney sequel, a movie I like but its ending really isn't as happy as the writers want you to think it is. Go see this movie before it becomes overrated.
